alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 14 at 5:50AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...A WINTRY MIX OF PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE SATURDAY MORNING... A warm front will lift north across the Southcentral coast for Saturday morning. Snow is expected to develop by early Saturday morning. However, as the front moves overhead, warmer air aloft will move across across Valdez and through Thompson Pass. Any snow is expected to changeover to a wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain before changing over to all rain later Saturday morning. A wintry mix of precipitation may also linger into early Saturday afternoon through Thompson Pass before winds shift to the south and the precipitation transitions to all rain. There is still some uncertainty in how long any freezing precipitation may linger before changing over to all rain. However, any ice accumulations on area roads, especially along the Richardson Highway, could lead to potentially hazardous travel conditions. For the latest forecast, please visit www.weather.gov/afc.
